wsd.ass

Class LogApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • wsd.ass.LogApplication

  • public class LogApplication
extends Object
    The Log Application class connects the Log XML file to the POJOs/JavaBeans (Log and Logs). It is the middleman for interacting with the underlying data through other classes.
    Author:
    Calvin

      • getFilePath

        public String getFilePath()
        Get the file path of the XML file
        Returns:
        the filepath of the XML file

      • setFilePath

        public void setFilePath(String filePath)
        Set the filepath of the XML file
        Parameters:
        filePath - the filepath to be set

      • unmarshall

        public void unmarshall()
                throws JAXBException,
                       IOException
        Unmarshall the Log XML file into the Logs ArrayList.
        Throws:
        JAXBException - if Logs class does not contain the correct elements to link with
        IOException - if the filepath is wrong or file does not exist

      • getLogs

        public Logs getLogs()
        Get all log entries
        Returns:
        an ArrayList containing all the log files

      • setLogs

        public void setLogs(Logs logs)
        Set all log entries
        Parameters:
        logs - an ArrayList containing all log files

      • hideLog

        public void hideLog(int id,
                    String user)
             throws FileNotFoundException,
                    JAXBException
        Hide the specified log
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the log to be hidden
        user - the user that is hiding the log
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the filepath is wrong or file does not exist
        JAXBException - if Logs class does not contain the correct elements to link with

      • marshall

        public void marshall()
              throws JAXBException,
                     FileNotFoundException
        Marshal the logs object back into xml format and output it to the filepath
        Throws:
        JAXBException - if Logs class does not contain the correct elements to link with
        FileNotFoundException - if the filepath is wrong or file does not exist

      • search

        public void search()

      • createLog

        public void createLog(Log log)
               throws FileNotFoundException,
                      JAXBException
        Add a new log entry to the logs object then marshall it back into xml
        Parameters:
        vehicle - Vehicle ID
        driver - Driver ID
        startDate - Start Date
        endDate - End Date
        startTime - Start Time
        endTime - End Time
        description - Description of entry
        kilometres - Kilometres drive
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException
        JAXBException
